lines.text: Pop, I want to talk to you as man to man.
I am ready, but you still have few years to go.
That's right.
People are always getting in trouble for talking too much, Pop.
Be sure you remember that.
Skeleton key, please!
You know, this is strictly illegal.
Four murders much more illegal!

[after Chan has checked the radium in the bank safe]
Why, Mr. Chan, surely you didn't expect to find anything wrong?
In my business always expect to find something wrong...

[annoyed that Tommy is still sitting down]
Rising generation sit too much!
You get illegal u-turn ticket?
Mr. Chan, I'll tell you just how it... Tommy, you tell 'im.
I warned you, Birmingham. I said, "No u-turn here."
Yeah, that's what you said - "No, you turn here."
I said "No u-turn here."
That's what I did. You said, "No, you turn here."
Pop, I told him, I said, "No u-turn here."
Yeah, that's what you said - "No, you turn here," and I did.
You see what I mean, Pop? I said, "No u-turn here."
Mr. Chan, did you hear? He said, "No, you...
Ple-please, please! U-turns, so many u-turns, you have my head spinning like merry-go-round. You remain here until I find doghouse big enough to hold both of you.
Too many hands sometime spoil pudding.

[as Chan leaves Ned and Paula in the restaurant]
Must you go, Mr. Chan?
Oh, quite necessary. Besides, much better for you to have dinner with young detective than with old detective.
Ancient ancestor once say, "Even wise man cannot fathom depth of woman's smile."
Cannot sell bearskin before shooting bear.
Mice will never play so long as cat is in house.

[annoyed]
Visitors are supposed to be announced!

[sarcastically]
Sorry, police do not read Emily Post.

[trapped in a cave-in as Charlie taps Morse Code]
Do you think you will get through, Pop?
If not, Number Three Son and father will join honorable ancestors.
Mr. Chan, tell your honorable ancestors to move over and make room for me.

[noticing Stewart who has come through a secret door]
Where'd you come from? I didn't see YOU come in?

[laconically]
You can see us all go out.
Yeah, yeah, I know you're police, but I ain't done nothin', no matter WHAT my ex-wife says.
Can you describe Van Horn?

Oh, sure. He was a sort of a short... oh, well, not too... kind of... well, he was a little bit on the heavy... oh, but his hair - oh, he had his hat on. He was just... j-just one of them mediocre guys, like you and me.
Oh, thank you so much. Yes. Splendid.
